emphasis.emphasis: These are instructions for configuring your Polycom IP 550 SIP phone to work with the Listen solution.S

section.title: Software Upgrade
section.para: For new phones, upgrade the phone's boot block and software versions to the latest 4.0.X release. More details can be found at the Polycom website at http://voipt2.polycom.com.
From the phone's local menu press Menu > Settings > Advanced (default password: 456) > Administration Settings > Network Configuration > Server Menu
Set Server Type to HTTP
Input Server Address as voipt2.polycom.com/401
Press the back button a few times until you get to Save Config.
After saving the settings press the back button two more times until you get the Advanced menu and then choose Reboot Phone.

The phone will update the boot ROM and the software. It will reboot itself two or three times. Do not interrupt until it is sitting at a screen with the Date and Time being displayed before you try to modify setting or make a call.

section.title: Restoring to Factory Settings
section.para: Use this to re-purpose a phone or reset a phone's settings.
From the phone's local menu press Menu > Settings > Advanced (default password: 456) > Administration Settings > Reset to Defaults
Reset Local Configuration - Yes
Reset Web Configuration - Yes
Reset Device Settings - Yes
Reset to Factory - Yes
The phone will reboot.
Do not interrupt until it is sitting at a screen with the Date and Time being displayed before you try to modify setting or make a call.
Then the unit will be reset.

section.title: Access the Web Configuration Utility Page
section.para: Find the IP address of the phone. From the phone's local menu press Menu > Status > Network > TCP/IP Paramaters
Enter the IP Address into your browser and you should have access to the phone's Web Configuration Utility page. Log in as Admin and password 456.

section.title: GUI Configuration
section.para: Go to the tab Preferences > Date & Time and set the SNTP Server and Time Zone.
Go to the tab Preferences > Additional preferences and set the values:
Click Save. The phone will reboot.
Go to the tab Settings > Network > QoS > Audio RTP
Go to the tab Settings > Network > QoS > Call Control
Click Save. The phone will reboot.
If you want to disable DHCP, go to the tab Settings > Network > Ethernet > General and enter the values in the mandatory fields.
Click Save. The phone will reboot.
Go to the tab Settings > SIP > Local Settings
Go to the tab Settings > SIP > Server1 and enter the Address of the SIP server. Use Port 5060 and Register set to Yes with Expires 3000 s.
Click Save. The phone will reboot.
Go to the tab Settings > SIP > Server1 > Lines > Line 1 > Identification (see figure below)
